name: 4h-thieno[2,3-b]thiopyran-2-sulfonamide, 5,6-dih
Reason: 1,2-thiadiazole ring formation introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +70°C. The sulfonamide group introduces a sulfur atom, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +10°C. The thiadiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +70°C. The presence of two additional phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to the ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
